newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish KPW clears Prochnik stake purchase.
newsitem.headline: Polish KPW clears Prochnik stake purchase.

text.p: The Polish Securities Commission (KPW) said it cleared the purchase of a 9.99-percent stake in Prochnik SA garment maker by National Investment Fund (NFI) "Piast" and allowed it to up its stake beyond 25 percent.

"The Securities Commission has not objected to a National Investment Fund Piast plan to buy shares giving it more than 25 percent of votes in...Prochnik," the commission said in a statement on Friday.

Piast agreed to buy, at 11 zlotys per share, less than 10 percent of Prochnik shares from a 25-percent Prochnik stake which had been held by the Westa insurance company and which went into receivership after Westa's bankruptcy.

The president of NFI 12 Rafal Zagorny told a news conference on Friday the fund was likely clinch the deal with Westa receiver in a bourse kerb transaction in the next few days and said the fund might later consider raising the stake in Prochnik.
"If this (the KPW approval) is confirmed we may think about it... we will see," Zagorny said, when asked whether the fund would buy the whole 25-percent batch.
Zagorny was speaking before the commission's statement was released.
